snippet: A bomb blast killed at least 24 people in northeastern Nigeria and hundreds of fighters invaded a town across the border in Cameroon in attacks Tuesday that witnesses and officials blame on Boko Haram Islamic extremists.
abstract: Nigerian officials blame Boko Haram for bombing at market in village of Sabon Gari that killed at least 24 people, and for separate invasion of town across border in Cameroon by hundreds of fighters.
lead_paragraph: A bomb blast killed at least 24 people in northeastern Nigeria and hundreds of fighters invaded a town across the border in Cameroon in attacks Tuesday that witnesses and officials blame on Boko Haram Islamic extremists.

headline.main: Bomb at Nigerian Market Kills 24, Extremists Attack Cameroon
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Nigeria: Militants Are Blamed for Deadly Attacks
